meanings.definition: A synthetic ergot alkaloid used to treat postpartum hemorrhage.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed ergonovine to help stop the bleeding after childbirth.
meanings.sent2: The hospital keeps a supply of ergonovine on hand for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The nurse joked that ergonovine was like a superhero for new moms, coming to the rescue.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against postpartum hemorrhage, ergonovine is the mighty warrior.
meanings.sent5: The image of ergonovine saving the day stuck in the patient's mind.

meanings.definition: To administer ergonovine to induce uterine contractions during labor.
meanings.sent1: The midwife will ergonovine to help speed up the labor process.
meanings.sent2: Doctors ergonovine carefully to avoid any complications during childbirth.
meanings.sent3: The nurse playfully suggested they ergonovine the baby out like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: Using ergonovine is like pressing fast-forward on the labor experience.
meanings.sent5: The idea of ergonovine gently nudging the uterus into action was comforting to the mother-to-be.
